Posts.Content: Strongfor3Boys wrote: The machine I was on needs repairs and will be down for a week.  They have moved everyone to a different machine, but did not do a new simulation.  They said the two machines are the same, so all the calculations can be transferred to the new machine, but I noticed that the times for the treatments are different on the two machines (e.g., 79 seconds for one field on the old machine, 66 seconds on the new), and also the boards are different.  If the radiation is supposed to be so precisely targeted, can they really switch machines, even of the same type, without recalculating?  I've felt so paranoid since the beginning, worried that they may be reading a number wrong, lining up a mark incorrectly, etc., and this twist makes my paranoia ten times worse!  Has anyone had to switch machines mid-treatment, and if so, did they do a new simulation? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Changing Machines During Treatment? Strongfor3Boys swimmingmom
